listitem.para: To provide a more direct route to the data in FlyMine, a number of queries have been predefined as templates. A template query is like a form with various boxes for you to fill in. A number of template queries have been predefined. These range from simple queries to more complex queries covering a wide range of data.

Template queries can be accessed from the main FlyMine query page. Templates can be selected either via a link from the class categories section, where the templates have also been divided into appropriate biological categories (note that a template query may belong in more than category) or from the 'Predefined template queries' section on the main query page, from where there is a link to all template queries (see screenshot below).

Select the query you wish to run either from the lists on the main Query page or by selecting 'view all template queries'. Pressing the -> next to the query description will take you to the template form.
Fill in the boxes with the appropriate values or leave them with the default values shown (see screenshot below).

Pressing the 'View results' button will take you directly to the results page (see The result page for more details). Pressing the 'View query' button will display the template query in the FlyMine Query Builder. Here you can either use the template as a starting point for building a more complex query, edit the query or simply run the query as it is. Press 'Show results' to run your query. See The FlyMine query builder for more details.
